text.section: In a general election for board of education members, a voter may vote for a number of nominees equal to the number of members to be elected.

section.section: The nominees, equal in number to the number of offices to be filled, who receive the largest number of votes in a general election shall be declared elected.
If two or more nominees each receive the lowest number of votes necessary to qualify for election, creating a tie for the last office to be filled, the office shall be considered vacant.

A vacancy occurring under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph shall be filled:
as if the vacancy occurred during the term of office for which the election is being held; and
by the selection of one of the nominees who ties in the general election.
